org.apache.juneau.reflect

Class MethodInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.reflect.ExecutableInfo
      • org.apache.juneau.reflect.MethodInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<MethodInfo>

    @BeanIgnore
public final class MethodInfo
extends ExecutableInfo
implements Comparable<MethodInfo>
    Lightweight utility class for introspecting information about a method.

    • Constructor Summary

      • inner

        public Method inner()
        Returns the wrapped method.
        Returns:
        The wrapped method.

      • getMatching

        public List<Method> getMatching()
        Finds all declared methods with the same name and arguments on all superclasses and interfaces.
        Returns:
        All matching methods including this method itself.
        Methods are ordered from child-to-parent order.

      • getMatchingParentFirst

        public Iterable<Method> getMatchingParentFirst()
        Convenience method for retrieving values in getMatching() in parent-to-child order.
        Returns:
        All matching methods including this method itself.
        Methods are ordered from parent-to-child order.

      • getAnnotations

        public <T extends Annotation> List<T> getAnnotations(Class<T> a)
        Returns all annotations of the specified type defined on the specified method.

        Searches all methods with the same signature on the parent classes or interfaces and the return type on the method.

        Parameters:
        a - The annotation to search for.
        Returns:
        A list of all matching annotations found in child-to-parent order, or an empty list if none found.

      • getAnnotationsParentFirst

        public <T extends Annotation> List<T> getAnnotationsParentFirst(Class<T> a)
        Identical to getAnnotations(Class) but returns the list in reverse (parent-to-child) order.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation to search for.
        Returns:
        A list of all matching annotations found or an empty list if none found.

      • appendAnnotations

        public <T extends Annotation> List<T> appendAnnotations(List<T> l,
                                                        Class<T> a)
        Finds and appends the specified annotation on the specified method and methods on superclasses/interfaces to the specified list.

        Results are ordered in child-to-parent order.

        Parameters:
        l - The list of annotations.
        a - The annotation.
        Returns:
        The same list.

      • appendAnnotationsParentFirst

        public <T extends Annotation> List<T> appendAnnotationsParentFirst(List<T> l,
                                                                   Class<T> a)
        Finds and appends the specified annotation on the specified class and superclasses/interfaces to the specified list.
        Parameters:
        l - The list of annotations.
        a - The annotation.
        Returns:
        The same list.

      • getAnnotation

        @SafeVarargs
public final Annotation getAnnotation(Class<? extends Annotation>... c)
        Returns the first annotation in the specified list on this method.
        Parameters:
        c - The annotations that cannot be present on the method.
        Returns:
        true if this method does not have any of the specified annotations.

      • getAnnotationList

        public AnnotationList getAnnotationList(Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter)
        Constructs an AnnotationList of all annotations found on this method.

        Annotations are appended in the following orders:

        1. On this method and matching methods ordered child-to-parent.
        2. On this class.
        3. On parent classes ordered child-to-parent.
        4. On interfaces ordered child-to-parent.
        5. On the package of this class.
        Parameters:
        filter - Optional filter to apply to limit which annotations are added to the list.
        Can be null for no filtering.
        Returns:
        A new AnnotationList object on every call.

      • getAnnotationListParentFirst

        public AnnotationList getAnnotationListParentFirst(Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter)
        Constructs an AnnotationList of all annotations found on this method.

        Annotations are appended in the following orders:

        1. On the package of this class.
        2. On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
        3. On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
        4. On this class.
        5. On this method and matching methods ordered parent-to-child.
        Parameters:
        filter - Optional filter to apply to limit which annotations are added to the list.
        Can be null for no filtering.
        Returns:
        A new AnnotationList object on every call.

      • getAnnotationListMethodOnlyParentFirst

        public AnnotationList getAnnotationListMethodOnlyParentFirst(Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> filter)
        Same as getAnnotationListParentFirst(Predicate) except only returns annotations defined on methods.
        Parameters:
        filter - Optional filter to apply to limit which annotations are added to the list.
        Can be null for no filtering.
        Returns:
        A new AnnotationList object on every call.

      • hasConfigAnnotations

        public boolean hasConfigAnnotations()
        Returns true if this method or parent methods have any annotations annotated with PropertyStoreApply.
        Returns:
        true if this method or parent methods have any annotations annotated with PropertyStoreApply.

      • getResolvedReturnType

        public ClassInfo getResolvedReturnType()
        Returns the generic return type of this method as a ClassInfo object.

        Unwraps the type if it's a Value.

        Returns:
        The generic return type of this method.

      • invoke

        public <T> T invoke(Object obj,
                    Object... args)
             throws ExecutableException
        Shortcut for calling the invoke method on the underlying method.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object the underlying method is invoked from.
        args - the arguments used for the method call
        Returns:
        The object returned from the method.
        Throws:
        ExecutableException - Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.

      • invokeFuzzy

        public Object invokeFuzzy(Object pojo,
                          Object... args)
                   throws ExecutableException
        Invokes the specified method using fuzzy-arg matching.

        Arguments will be matched to the parameters based on the parameter types.
        Arguments can be in any order.
        Extra arguments will be ignored.
        Missing arguments will be left null.

        Note that this only works for methods that have distinguishable argument types.
        It's not going to work on methods with generic argument types like Object

        Parameters:
        pojo - The POJO the method is being called on.
        Can be null for static methods.
        args - The arguments to pass to the method.
        Returns:
        The results of the method invocation.
        Throws:
        ExecutableException - Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.

      • getSignature

        public String getSignature()
        Returns the signature of this method.

        For no-arg methods, the signature will be a simple string such as "toString". For methods with one or more args, the arguments will be fully-qualified class names (e.g. "append(java.util.StringBuilder,boolean)")

        Returns:
        The methods signature.

      • getPropertyName

        public String getPropertyName()
        Returns the bean property name if this is a getter or setter.
        Returns:
        The bean property name, or null if this isn't a getter or setter.

      • argsOnlyOfType

        public boolean argsOnlyOfType(Class<?>... args)
        Returns true if the parameters on the method only consist of the types specified in the list.
        Example:

        // Example method: public void foo(String bar, Integer baz); argsOnlyOfType(fooMethod, String.class, Integer.class); // True. argsOnlyOfType(fooMethod, String.class, Integer.class, Map.class); // True. argsOnlyOfType(fooMethod, String.class); // False.

        Parameters:
        args - The valid class types (exact) for the arguments.
        Returns:
        true if the method parameters only consist of the types specified in the list.

      • isBridge

        public boolean isBridge()
        Returns true if this method is a bridge method.
        Returns:
        true if this method is a bridge method.
